result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Alexander James Rietz in court.  Attorney Grace Hagerman in court for Alexander James Rietz.  Prosecuting attorney J J. Crawford in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made. Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court. Minutes filed.

Defendant Alexander James Rietz in court.  Prosecuting attorney J J. Crawford in court for the State of Wisconsin. Minutes filed.

Defendant Alexander James Rietz not in court.  Attorney Grace Hagerman in court for Alexander James Rietz.  Prosecuting attorney J J. Crawford in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defense received a global offer on both files, Attorney Hagerman unsure why defendant is not in court. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Alexander James Rietz in court.  Attorney Grace Hagerman specially appearing in court for Alexander James Rietz.  Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin. Victim also in court and does not wish to make a statement. Defendant does not qualify for SPD representation.  Was given or mailed petition for court appointed representation. Court advises defendant he will need to retain an attorney.  Defendant given complaint; charges/penalties explained by the court. Minutes filed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

records.addlTxt: Signed bond filed with the court.

BOND TO COVER 22GF886 & 22CM248 ($2000 ALREADY POSTED)

DEFENDANT MUST LEAVE FATHER'S HOUSE WHEN ASKED. TAKE ALL PRESCRIBED MEDICATIONS AND FOLLOW PHYSICIAN/PROVIDER RECOMMENDATION FOR TREATMENT. Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant is not to enter any bars, taverns, or liquor stores. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. NO VIOLENT CONTACT WITH E.R.V. dob 10-27-1989. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
22-3925,3926

Called at 1:28 PM. Defendant Alexander J Rietz in court, in custody by video. Samuel Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Grace Hagerman appeared specially. Not eligible for SPD if released. Record by the State as to history of referrals and charging history. Victim, father present in court and makes a statement to the court. Record by Attorney Hagerman who objects to increase in cash. Court declines to increase bond at this time. Prior bond to cover new charges with all prop conditions and added condition. Minutes filed.
Hearing scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.
